dcterms:creator: C. Zhang
F. Gao
B. Jia
Y. Zhu
S.-C. Zhu
dcterms:description: The RAVEN dataset consists of 70,000 samples, each containing a 3Ã—3 image matrix with the last one missing and 8 candidate answers. The objective is to deduce reasoning rules from the first 8 images and choose the most suitable image from the 8 candidate answers as the correct one.
dcterms:title: RAVEN

dcterms:creator: S. Hu
Y. Ma
X. Liu
Y. Wei
S. Bai
dcterms:description: The I-RAVEN dataset is a variant of the RAVEN dataset, designed to eliminate shortcuts to the correct answer by balancing candidate answer sets. It generates negative candidate answers through hierarchical permutations of attributes.
dcterms:title: I-RAVEN

dcterms:creator: A. Santoro
F. Hill
D. Barrett
A. Morcos
T. Lillicrap
dcterms:description: The Procedurally Generated Matrices dataset is the first RPM-like dataset constructed to measure abstract reasoning in neural networks, providing a basis for evaluating reasoning algorithms.
dcterms:title: Procedurally Generated Matrices
